snippet: The Swiss food giant will no longer buy from farms that keep animals in packed cages or that dehorn cattle or dock their tails without anesthesia, among other things.
abstract: Nestle is adopting animal welfare standards that will affect 7,300 of its suppliers around the globe, and their suppliers; move is one of the broadest-reaching commitments to improving life for animals in the food system.
lead_paragraph: The Swiss food giant will no longer buy from farms that keep animals in packed cages or that dehorn cattle or dock their tails without anesthesia, among other things.

headline.main: Nestlé Moves Toward Humane Treatment of Animals at Its Suppliers
headline.print_headline: Nestlé Moves Toward Humane Treatment of Animals at Its Suppliers
